N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 700.2 - Who may appeal; timeliness

State Regulations
A purchaser of any correctional industries product or service
(other than license plates) may appeal the price of the product or service to
the Price Review Board at any time prior to or within 30 days of the time of
sale and upon payment of the price. The board may permit the filing of an
appeal prior to actual payment of the price upon a satisfactory showing by
appellant that it has completed all acts necessary on its part to make payment
and that payment will be made no later than 60 days after the filing of the
appeal. Where the board permits such an appeal to be filed prior to actual
payment, and appellant thereafter fails to make actual payment within 60 days
after filing its appeal, such failure to pay shall divest the board of
jurisdiction and the appeal will be dismissed. The sole grounds for bringing
such appeal is that the price as established by the commissioner unreasonably
exceeds the fair market price for such goods or services as defined in this

Part, or that the fair market price was not established in accordance with
section
186 (2)
of the Correction
